Comment.val: /*Calculates base and fee and processes these when applicable.*/
/*Is the first calculation which potentially triggers calculations of following periods.*/
/*Calculated Fee Header Id of which the processing triggered the current calculation. Only relevant for asynchronic processing.*/

/*TRUE = period will be maximized by the given ReferenceDate. FALSE=Only period endings compliant to the calculation frequency and before the given ReferenceDate are returned except for calculation variants 4 and 5 which will always be maximized.*/
/*Only one Magic session is used to calculate and process the fees. No JMS messages are used.*/
/*No calculation is needed when calculationvariant =5(intermediate), charge_type<> 7 and the incassomethod is not set. In that case, the service has to set a succesfull resonse.*/

Text.val: Message variables:
1 Regular, 3 ProForma, 4 Termination, 5 Intermediate, 9 Concept
For now synchronous processing is hardcoded for both concept as termination calculations:
Not for synchronously processing and Not initiated by a previous calculation :

Comment.val: /*Loops all charge types of the given product or just the selected one.*/

Text.val: Termination (4) and concept (9) both use incasso method 1 (Geldboeking standaard transactierekening) hardcoded for now :
Charge type=7 (intermediair vergoeding) must always be calculated. All other charge type only must
be calculated when an incasso method is present. 'v_IncassoMethod_Used' is NOT used in this expression
because in case of terminations this variable can contain a value when 'v_IncassoMethod' does not!
This would cause the fee to be charged in spite of the fact that no incasso method was defined!
In the first run delete all unfinished calculations of the processed charge type:
First : Calculate all 'sub' periods per charge period:
Second: Charge (all) periods:
Check if external service fee messages must be send --> Incasso Method = 8 (=grid 6 (Settlement via external system))
Only one PPR_ID will be present, so only one record can be processed:
Only when a reply is needed, but nothing is calculated :
When an intermediate calculation(5) with charge type<>7 is executed without an incasso method being present
a new productfee line is created :
Calculation of the servicefee will be done up to and including the reference date. The fee can only be calculated on data
that isn't subdue to changes. This is why the reference date must always be before today.
When the start date of the period of the calculation trigger is equal or smaller than the fee charge start date there are
possibly old calculations which aren't taken in account. If so then check the latest completed old calculation:
This check will eventually be redundant and can then be deleted.
Only determine the 'new' first calculation period when an old calculation has been found and lies after the fee charge startdate
and before the fee charge end date:
Only update vector when not recursively called from 'StartNextCalculation'
Only the first calc run id per charge type!
To enable termination of an account which is created today (reference date will be yesterday, start_date will be today):
